page.title: 08HOUSES IN LOCAL VILLAGES
page.content: Houses in the four villages were quite similar: In all of the villages there was a mixture of new housing developments alongside older dwellings. The older houses tended to be clustered around the village church, whilst the newer houses were added on the outskirts of the villages. The older houses were built of local stone and it was apparent that the new houses had been carefully designed to fit into the environment. The village of Stibbington contained some Local Authority dwellings but most of the houses were privately owned. House prices in all of the villages were on average higher than those in the wider area due to the many attractions of village life.
